definition: (particle used to exaggerate certain adjectives, in particular 神經兮兮|神经兮兮, 髒兮兮|脏兮兮, 可憐兮兮|可怜兮兮, and 慘兮兮|惨兮兮)
(particle in old Chinese similar to 啊)
(particle in old Chinese similar to 啊)

sentences.english: Love is washing his sports togs.
sentences.chinese: 愛是幫他清洗髒兮兮的運動衣。

sentences.english: When she last saw him, he was a sad ─old and tired.
sentences.chinese: 她上次見到他時，他一副慘兮兮的樣子蒼老而疲憊。

sentences.english: He saw some cars coming down the dirt road one after another.
sentences.chinese: 他看到一輛接一輛的車沿着那條髒兮兮的路開過來。

sentences.english: Even the smudged windows framed a night so black that I could see nothing there but my own pale face.
sentences.chinese: 髒兮兮的窗子一片黑暗，只能映出我蒼白的臉。

sentences.english: Bedding was strewn on the floor and dirty teacups stacked in a corner.
sentences.chinese: 寢具散在地板上，髒兮兮的茶具塞在角落裏。

sentences.english: You both get dirty, and the pig likes it.
sentences.chinese: 你倆都會弄得髒兮兮，但是豬喜歡那樣。

sentences.english: It's dirty and has an uncouth culture.
sentences.chinese: 那裏髒兮兮的，文化又粗俗。

sentences.english: Cook's bedroom slippers were patched and dirty.
sentences.chinese: 廚娘的拖鞋髒兮兮的，補丁也不少。

sentences.english: Once the lens turn and a devil with disgustingly dirty whole body appear on the hill path.
sentences.chinese: 鏡頭一轉，一個渾身髒兮兮的妖怪出現在山路上。

sentences.english: Feel whole body a disgustingly dirty cowboy handsome and foolish at the age of 20 .
sentences.chinese: 二十歲的時候，覺得一身髒兮兮的牛仔服就帥呆了。
嘿，別那麼可憐兮兮的了。

sentences.english: So Dubuisson is used to coming home filthy from the field.
sentences.chinese: 所以迪比森從野外回到家時，身上經常髒兮兮的。

sentences.english: Basket is so dirty, Lotus also be smoked with a dirty-like.
sentences.chinese: 籮筐是那樣髒，蓮藕也跟被煙燻了似的髒兮兮的。

sentences.english: Get jumpy, it must be another my mischief.
sentences.chinese: 變的神經兮兮，那一定是另外一個我的惡作劇。

definition: as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
lit. to behave like a thief/furtive/underhand
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to giggle/to laugh foolishly/to smirk/to simper
